questions.question: Which sentence uses an adverb of time?
options: She danced gracefully across the stage.
They arrived late to the meeting.
He answered the question correctly.
The child played happily in the garden.
questions.answer: They arrived late to the meeting.

questions.question: Which sentence contains a misplaced adverb?
options: He only ate the vegetables on his plate.
Only he ate the vegetables on his plate.
He ate only the vegetables on his plate.
He ate the vegetables only on his plate.
questions.answer: He only ate the vegetables on his plate.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses an adverb of certainty?
options: She sings quite well for her age.
He is probably going to miss the bus.
They spoke clearly during the presentation.
I silently left the room.
questions.answer: He is probably going to miss the bus.

questions.question: Which sentence uses an adverb to modify an adjective?
options: She drives carefully on wet roads.
He speaks very slowly when explaining things.
The room was extremely cold in the morning.
We waited patiently for the doctor.
questions.answer: The room was extremely cold in the morning.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an adverb?
options: Quickly
Yesterday
Beautiful
Sometimes
